config.text: Force screen capture to go to the clipboard
Start interaction in window selection mode
In window capture mode, do not capture the shadow of the window
In window capture mode, capture the screen instead of the window

script:
function screenshot_name {
  local -r date_name="Screenshot $(date '+%F') at $(date '+%H.%M.%S')"

  if [[ ! -e "${date_name}.png" ]]
  then
    printf '%s.png' "${date_name}"
    return
  fi

  local count=1

  while [[ -e "${date_name} ${count}.png" ]]
  do
    count="$(bc <<< "${count} + 1")"
  done

  printf '%s %s.png' "${date_name}" "${count}"
}

opts=()
readonly screenshot="${HOME}/Desktop/$(screenshot_name)"

[[ "${to_clipboard}" -eq 1 ]] && opts+=(-c)
[[ "${window_mode}" -eq 1 ]] && opts+=(-W)
[[ "${no_window_shadow}" -eq 1 ]] && opts+=(-o)
[[ "${screen_area}" -eq 1 ]] && opts+=(-S)

/usr/sbin/screencapture -i "${opts[@]}" "${screenshot}"

printf '%s' "${screenshot}"
taskDescription: Interactively save image of custom screen area
